text: Hey there all you GRRR Travelers!
Thanks for joining me again today.
Today I thought I'd do a video for you,

…sharing with you some of the things I bought
in India for souvenirs.

I didn't want to do a whole lot of buying
on this trip.
Because I know my trip is going to be…
I'm going to continue on after this country.
So I don't want to carry too many things.

So the main quest to find things what were
lightweight and small.
And hopefully not buying anything at all.
But inevitably, I had to a little bit of shopping.

Just to fit in with the culture and to have
fun.

So along with a lot of spiritual stickers
you also see a lot of this 3D art.
Where you can see the deities change form.
Very interesting.
I got this shirt which i"m very happy with.

I also got another shirt which you'll be seeing
in some of my videos.
The fabric is thin, so it kinda tears easily.

I had a lady wash my clothes and she made
holes in it.
But it's still…
I'm still going to wear it anyways.

then brush.

does.

no.

Here in Pushkar, there's a lot of tailors,
so the clothes here are something to buy.
I bought this lovely pair of silk pants.

I really like it because it has a very Rajasthani
feel or look.

It's very flowing and kinda comfortable and
cool.

I got this for 400 rupees and he threw in
this bag, which is beautiful.
It's a draw string bag.

I've seen some vendors put clothing in homemade
bags and it's amazing.
It's wonderful.
I got this at an actual store.

Upon wearing it's not as comfortable as I
thought it would be.
I was hoping it would be cooler.
But it's still nice.

And I feel like I stand out a little less
when I wear it.
Its hard not to want to spend money .
Because some of these things are so cute.

And you know it's going to cost like, triple

stores in the United States.

So I hope you enjoyed this video
So I think theses are very good deals,
and i'm very happy with them.
